overview: A 36-week Pre-Calculus course built on a 10-unit scope and sequence. Bridges algebra, geometry, and trigonometry to calculus through advanced function analysis, trigonometry (foundations and advanced), analytic geometry, vectors, complex numbers, sequences/series, and an introduction to limits. Spiral review threads are woven throughout every checkpoint.
naturalProgression: Begin with Readiness Boot Camp (Unit 0) to diagnose and fill gaps from Algebra 2 before new content
Build a comprehensive function toolkit (Unit 1) with transformations, composition, and inverses across all parent families
Deep dive into polynomial and rational functions (Unit 2) with factoring theorems, asymptotic analysis, and inequalities
Master exponential and logarithmic functions (Unit 3) as inverse pairs with properties, equations, and real-world modeling
Establish trigonometry foundations (Unit 4) from radian measure through unit circle, graphs, identities, equations, and sinusoidal modeling
Extend to advanced trigonometry (Unit 5) with inverse trig, sum/difference/double/half-angle formulas, Law of Sines/Cosines, and triangle applications
Explore analytic geometry (Unit 6) with conics (parabola, ellipse, hyperbola), parametric equations, and polar coordinates/curves
Develop vector reasoning (Unit 7) with dot product, projections, applications (work/forces/navigation), and complex numbers in polar form with DeMoivre's Theorem
Discover sequences, series, and limits (Unit 8) with arithmetic/geometric sequences, sigma notation, convergence, algebraic limits, and continuity as a bridge to calculus
Synthesize all skills through comprehensive review and a final mastery assessment (Unit 9)
spiralReviewThreads: Algebraic fluency — factoring, completing the square, and simplification maintained through checkpoint spiral problems
Function analysis — domain, range, composition, and inverse reasoning applied across all function families
Trigonometric reasoning — unit circle values, identities, and equation solving reinforced from Unit 4 onward
Graphical interpretation — connecting algebraic forms to visual features across polynomials, trig, conics, and polar curves
Mathematical modeling — real-world problem contexts integrated progressively from Unit 1 through Unit 9

aiInstructionModel.description: The AI tutor leads all instruction using the gradual release model (I Do / We Do / You Do) but has full freedom to make instructional decisions. Module files provide scope, key concepts, teaching guidance, and reference problems—NOT rigid scripts. The AI decides pacing, chooses examples, adjusts scaffolding, and personalizes based on the student's skill mastery, learning profile, and real-time responses.

phases.aiRole: Build conceptual understanding before procedures. The AI introduces the BIG IDEA using real-world connections, student interests, and visual/physical analogies.
phases.studentRole: Engage with the concept, ask questions, make predictions

phases.aiRole: Model 2-3 worked examples with think-aloud reasoning. The AI selects problem difficulty based on the student's current mastery.
phases.studentRole: Observe, ask clarifying questions, identify patterns

phases.aiRole: Quick comprehension check before moving to practice. If gaps detected, the AI re-teaches before proceeding.
phases.studentRole: Explain understanding in own words, answer concept questions

phases.aiRole: Guided practice with adaptive scaffolding. Scaffolding decreases as the student demonstrates understanding.
phases.studentRole: Attempt problems with AI support, explain reasoning

phases.aiRole: Emotional and confidence assessment. Adjusts pacing and tone based on student engagement.
phases.studentRole: Reflect on confidence and comfort level

phases.aiRole: Independent practice. Minimal hints—only if the student is stuck.
Formal assessment for skill mastery using 4-Pillar criteria (accuracy, independence, transfer, retention).

aiDecisionRights: Choose which examples and problems to present (module provides reference problems, AI may generate its own)
Adjust difficulty in real-time based on student performance
Skip or extend phases based on student readiness
Re-order skills within a module if pedagogically appropriate
Generate additional practice or enrichment as needed
Use student interests and learning profile to personalize examples
Decide when to advance to the next skill or re-teach
Select teaching strategies (visual, algebraic, numerical, verbal) based on student profile
Adjust tone and pacing based on emotional signals and anxiety level

modules.title: Readiness Boot Camp
modules.preview: Diagnose and fill Algebra 2 gaps before new Pre-Calculus content
essentialQuestions: Which Algebra 2 skills are secure and which need reinforcement?
How does function notation and analysis carry into Pre-Calculus?
Why is algebraic fluency the foundation for every advanced topic?

lessons.title: Algebraic Fluency Review
lessons.teachingNotes: Diagnostic-first: assess before reteaching. Skip secure skills.

lessons.title: Function Analysis Review
lessons.teachingNotes: Critical foundation for function toolkit unit. Ensure automatic fluency.

lessons.title: Quadratic, Exponential & Log Review
lessons.teachingNotes: Completing the square is essential for conics. Log properties are essential for advanced solving.

modules.title: Unit 0 Diagnostic Checkpoint
modules.preview: Assess readiness for Pre-Calculus content

modules.title: Function Toolkit & Transformations
modules.preview: Parent function library, transformations, composition, inverses
essentialQuestions: How do transformations connect all parent function families through one template?
What does it mean for two functions to be inverses, and how is this visible on a graph?
How does composition build complex functions from simple ones?

lessons.title: Parent Function Library
concepts: Linear, quadratic, cubic, square root, cube root, absolute value
Key features: domain, range, intercepts, symmetry
lessons.teachingNotes: Build the visual library first. Students should recognize graphs instantly.

lessons.title: Transformations Toolkit
lessons.teachingNotes: Master the general template. Apply to every parent function.

lessons.title: Composition & Inverse Functions
lessons.teachingNotes: Inverses are critical for logarithms and inverse trig. Build strong foundation.

modules.title: Unit 1 Checkpoint: Function Toolkit
modules.preview: Assess function families, transformations, composition, inverses

modules.title: Polynomial & Rational Functions
modules.preview: End behavior, zeros, division, asymptotes, inequalities
essentialQuestions: How do the degree and leading coefficient control a polynomial's end behavior?
What information do zeros, multiplicity, and the Rational Root Theorem reveal?
How do asymptotes describe the behavior of rational functions near restricted values and at infinity?

lessons.title: Polynomial Functions: End Behavior & Zeros
lessons.teachingNotes: Build from quadratics to higher degree. Emphasize the connection between zeros and factors.

lessons.title: Polynomial Division & Factor Theorem
lessons.teachingNotes: Synthetic division is a tool for finding zeros efficiently. Connect to Rational Root Theorem.

lessons.title: Rational Functions & Inequalities
concepts: Polynomial and rational inequalities via sign analysis
lessons.teachingNotes: Emphasize domain awareness. Holes vs. vertical asymptotes is a common confusion point.

modules.title: Unit 2 Checkpoint: Polynomial & Rational Functions
modules.preview: Assess polynomial/rational analysis and inequalities

modules.title: Exponential & Logarithmic Functions
modules.preview: Properties, equations, modeling, growth/decay
essentialQuestions: How are exponential and logarithmic functions inverses of each other?
When and why do we use logarithms to solve equations?
How do exponential models describe real-world growth and decay?

lessons.title: Exponential Functions & Properties
lessons.teachingNotes: Connect to compound interest and population growth for real-world context.

lessons.title: Logarithmic Functions & Properties
lessons.teachingNotes: Inverses of exponentials. Students must see logs as 'asking: what exponent?'

lessons.title: Solving Equations & Modeling
lessons.teachingNotes: Always check for extraneous solutions in log equations. Domain restrictions matter.

modules.title: Unit 3 Checkpoint: Exponential & Logarithmic Functions
modules.preview: Assess exponential/log properties, solving, and modeling

modules.title: Trigonometry Foundations
modules.preview: Radians, unit circle, graphs, identities, equations, modeling
essentialQuestions: How does the unit circle unify all six trig functions?
What do the parameters A, B, C, D in y=Asin(B(x-C))+D each control?
How do trig identities transform one expression into another equivalent form?

lessons.title: Radian Measure & the Unit Circle
lessons.teachingNotes: Unit circle mastery is non-negotiable. Students must know exact values for standard angles.

lessons.title: Trigonometric Function Graphs
concepts: Amplitude, period, phase shift, vertical shift
lessons.teachingNotes: y=Asin(B(x-C))+D is the master equation. Connect to real-world periodic phenomena.

lessons.title: Identities & Trig Equations
lessons.teachingNotes: Identity proofs develop algebraic reasoning. Equation solving requires quadrant analysis.

modules.title: Unit 4 Checkpoint: Trigonometry Foundations
modules.preview: Assess radian measure, unit circle, graphs, identities, equations

modules.title: Advanced Trig & Applications
modules.preview: Inverse trig, sum/difference/double/half-angle, Law of Sines/Cosines
essentialQuestions: Why do inverse trig functions require restricted domains?
How do sum/difference and double/half-angle formulas extend the identity toolbox?
When do you use Law of Sines vs. Law of Cosines, and what is the ambiguous case?

lessons.title: Inverse Trigonometric Functions
concepts: Restricted domains for arcsin, arccos, arctan
Compositions of trig and inverse trig
lessons.teachingNotes: Restricted domains are the key concept. Students must understand WHY restriction is needed.

lessons.title: Sum/Difference & Double/Half-Angle Formulas
lessons.teachingNotes: Exact value computation is the key application. Connect to unit circle values.

lessons.title: Law of Sines, Law of Cosines & Triangle Area
lessons.teachingNotes: Decision tree: which law for which given information? SSA ambiguous case is the tricky scenario.

modules.title: Unit 5 Checkpoint: Advanced Trig & Applications
modules.preview: Assess inverse trig, advanced identities, triangle solving

modules.title: Analytic Geometry, Parametric & Polar
modules.preview: Conics, parametric equations, polar coordinates and curves
essentialQuestions: How does completing the square reveal the geometric properties of conic sections?
How do parametric equations describe motion and curves that aren't functions?
How do polar coordinates provide an alternative way to describe position and curves?

lessons.title: Conic Sections: Parabolas, Ellipses, Hyperbolas
concepts: General form to standard form via completing the square
lessons.teachingNotes: Each conic has a geometric definition (locus). Connect algebra to geometry visually.

lessons.title: Parametric Equations
lessons.teachingNotes: Parametric adds direction/time to curves. Connect to conics (ellipse as x=acost, y=bsint).

lessons.title: Polar Coordinates & Curves
concepts: Polar curves: roses, limaçons, cardioids, lemniscates
lessons.teachingNotes: Multiple representations of the same point. Polar curves reveal beautiful mathematical patterns.

modules.title: Unit 6 Checkpoint: Analytic Geometry, Parametric & Polar
modules.preview: Assess conics, parametric elimination, polar conversions/curves

modules.title: Vectors & Complex Numbers in Polar Form
modules.preview: Vector operations, dot product, projections, DeMoivre's Theorem
essentialQuestions: How do vectors encode both magnitude and direction in one mathematical object?
What does the dot product reveal about the relationship between two vectors?
How does polar form simplify multiplication, powers, and roots of complex numbers?

lessons.title: Vector Representation & Operations
lessons.teachingNotes: Geometric and algebraic approaches side by side. Tip-to-tail and parallelogram rules.

lessons.title: Dot Product & Projections
lessons.teachingNotes: The dot product is the key tool for angle and projection. u·v=0 means perpendicular.

lessons.title: Applications & Complex Numbers in Polar Form
lessons.teachingNotes: Connect vectors to physics. Complex polar form extends polar coordinates to algebraic operations.

modules.title: Unit 7 Checkpoint: Vectors & Complex Numbers
modules.preview: Assess vectors, dot product, applications, DeMoivre's Theorem

modules.title: Sequences, Series & Introduction to Limits
modules.preview: Arithmetic/geometric sequences, sigma notation, limits, continuity
essentialQuestions: How do arithmetic and geometric sequences model different types of growth?
When does an infinite series converge, and what does the sum represent?
What is a limit, and why is it the foundational concept of calculus?

lessons.title: Arithmetic & Geometric Sequences
lessons.teachingNotes: Connect geometric series to real-world: repeating decimals, bouncing balls, compound interest.

lessons.title: Series & Sigma Notation
concepts: Sum formulas for k, k², k³
lessons.teachingNotes: Sigma notation is the compact language of series. Practice expanding and writing.

lessons.title: Introduction to Limits & Continuity
concepts: Intuitive limits from tables and graphs
Limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes
lessons.teachingNotes: This is the bridge to calculus. Limits unify everything: sequences, series, asymptotes, instantaneous rate of change.

modules.title: Unit 8 Checkpoint: Sequences, Series & Limits
modules.preview: Assess sequences, series, limits, and continuity

modules.title: Final Review & Exam Preparation
modules.preview: Comprehensive spiral review across all content areas
essentialQuestions: How do the major function families connect and differ?
What are the most important problem-solving strategies across all topics?
How does each Pre-Calculus topic prepare you for Calculus?

lessons.title: Review: Functions, Polynomials, Exp/Log
lessons.teachingNotes: Diagnostic-driven review. Focus on student-specific weak areas.

lessons.title: Review: Trigonometry Comprehensive

lessons.title: Review: Conics, Vectors, Series & Limits
